intro: Galium donetzkiensis, commonly known as Donetsky's bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the steppes of southern Russia and Ukraine. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium donetzkiensis is adapted to dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils.
